result.execSummary:
The defendant Tori M. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full.  Seized money to be applied when received.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or be enrolled in education full time or a combination of both.

Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where they believe such contraband as defined in Chapter 961 may be present.
Defendant shall not associate with any known drug users.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall use only one (1) pharmacy.
Defendant shall report all healthcare visits and prescriptions to Agent within 48 hours.
Defendant shall take prescription medication in the manner and method as prescribed.
Credit of 35 days, if probation is revoked.
Partial payment.  Seized money to be applied when received.
